result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles W. Hawley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles W. Hawley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles W. Hawley was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Charles W. Hawley in court with attorney Jennifer Amelia Cunha.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Held with 16CM205 and 16CM73.    Agreed upon resolution.  Rights/elements.  No contest pleato Ct 1 OWI 3rd.  BAC and OAR dismissed.  Court imposed 50 days jail with huber commence 10-21-16 @ . In OAR charge, costs $443.00 imposed due 60 days or payplan.  DNA sample to be submitted.   Court accepted plea, adjudged guilty, JOC entered.
